definition: a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: One day, while sitting outside in his lawn chair, Larry had his eureka moment.
sentences.chinese: 一天，當拉里坐在屋外的摺椅上時，突然靈機一動。

sentences.english: Thensuddenly, an idea came into her racing, terrified brain.
sentences.chinese: 後來她靈機一動，恐懼的大腦想出一個主意。

sentences.english: Why dont she a brainwave, through right rare to du from far away.
sentences.chinese: 她靈機一動，何不通過右少見到杜自遠。

sentences.english: He got an idea. He removed the map, and then patiently tore it up into small pieces.
sentences.chinese: 他靈機一動，把地圖撕下來，耐心地撕成小塊。

sentences.english: His inspiration, come up with a "imitative" strategy.
sentences.chinese: 東方朔靈機一動，想出一個“照方抓藥”的計謀。

sentences.english: At this dark and hopeless moment an inspiration burst upon him!
sentences.chinese: 正在這灰心絕望的時刻，他忽然靈機一動，計上心來。

definition: to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
